images.title: Barista Coffee Cafe
images.description: The cafe owner saw me sketching and I gave this sketch to her. :)

images.title: Overlooking Rifugio Biella
images.description: I stayed in huts (rifugios) throughout my Alta Via 1 hike. Depending on the route that day, I’d arrive at anytime between lunch and late afternoon. There is plenty to do in the rifugio, most people would chat with other hikers, play cards or board games. Meanwhile for me when not chatting with other hikers, I’d spend my time painting or reading. On the first day, I stayed in Rifugio Biella. As much as I would have loved to sketch outdoors, we happened to have a snowstorm the night before, so it was really cold when I got there, so I decided to sketch mountains from the comfort of the rifugio instead while enjoying two(!) cups of hot chocolate.

images.title: Inside Rifugio Biella
images.description: I would have loved to sketch outdoors, but unfortunately it was too cold! I decided to take a picture and sketch in the rifugio instead. I saw this unreal landscape after a 4 hour grueling, icy hike from Lago di Braies to Rifugio Biella. Normally this landscape would have been dominated by greens, but because of the snowstorm the day before, everything turned into white. One of the staff at the rifugio saw me painting and joked if they could keep it. I thought why not and decided to paint them another one.

images.title: Rifugio Città di Fiume
images.description: Fifth day on the trail and it was a loooong day—made it to the hut at 5 because I accidentally took the difficult route that required a lot of hands on scrambling, got my feet sucked into the mud and encountered some hails and rain along the way. Surprisingly I still had a little bit of energy to sketch before dinner :)

images.title: Ücia Rifugio Fanes
images.description: Still lots of snow in today’s hike, but at least I got to use some greens when sketching this view in front of Rifugio Fanes, my second rifugio on the trail. It was a long day so I didn’t have a lot of time to sketch, but was pretty happy I got to sketch outside today!

images.title: Lago di Braies
images.description: This is the starting point of the Alta Via 1 trail, if you’re hiking north to south. The day before, I visited Lago di Braies to sketch. It was unusually chilly and I noticed the snow-capped peaks in the distance… little did I know just how much snow I’d soon be trekking through the next few days!

images.title: Lago Limides
images.description: I haven’t been able to sketch on the trail up until this day because the weather was unpredictable, and I had to make sure that I arrive in my next hut before the forecasted rain. However today was an exception—the weather was clear, no rain was forecasted, and I also happened to have a rather short day (+- 12 km) with an okay-ish elevation gain and loss, so I thought I could just put down my backpack and hiking poles, chill for a bit, and do a quick sketch.

images.title: Rifugio Nuvolau exterior view
images.description: Sketching the first ever rifugio in the Dolomites, built in the 1883 🗻 it’s hard to pick favorites but this is definitely one of my favorite rifugios I’ve stayed in—phenomenal location, very lovely staff, and amazing food!

images.title: Inside the cafe in Rifugio Nuvolau
images.description: Sketching at the bar while waiting for check in :)

images.title: Rifugio Passo Duran Cesare Tomè
images.description: Day 8 on the trail of Alta Via 1 🏔️ the hike is drawing to a close and although today I was at a lower elevation compared to the first few days, there were still some tough sections. Today felt especially long because I got lost among the boulders, slipped a couple of times and bumped my left knee into a huge rock. At some point I felt like giving up. But then I thought: what’s 2 more days? I decided to keep walking and eventually I made it to Rifugio Passo Duran C. Tomè, where I spent the afternoon doing a little sketch, reviewing next day’s trail and weather forecast with other hikers. The next day was supposed to be even tougher and longer with a chance of thunderstorm, and everyone in the hut was quite nervous about it…

images.title: Rifugio Pian de Fontana
images.description: Last sketch from Alta Via 1 🏔️ gotta be honest, I did this in quite a hurry. It was my longest day yet—23 km in total—where in the last section I had to ascend for 5 km straight, cross a ridge that was exposed in both sides before eventually making another constant descent of 5 km on loose rocks followed by a narrow and steep trail that was marked by a signage as a “difficult” trail, all while hurrying to avoid the thunderstorm. The number of times I actually slipped was embarrassing. The moment I stepped into my hut, it started raining heavily, and there was a thunderstorm throughout the night. But I also felt proud of myself because after all the snow, hails, and rain, I never thought I’d actually make it this far!

images.title: Rifugio Mario Vazzoler
images.description: Lower elevation this time, started seeing more and more greens 🍃 seventh day on the trail! This is Rifugio Vazzoler and I sketched the hut from the alpine herbs garden across the street. I honestly couldn’t believe I’d make it this far especially that I set off on this journey by myself and the first few days were especially so tough. But I met so many kind and nice people along the way who would hike some parts with me or whom I’d share lovely breakfast and dinner with, and we’d cheer for each other despite having to part ways at the end :)
